hooks.prompt: Check if the user's message mentions any frontend frameworks (React, Next.js, Vue, Angular, Svelte, Nuxt), deployment topics (deploy, production, release, ship), or DevOps needs (CI/CD, pipeline, docker, kubernetes, terraform, infrastructure). If detected and DevOps setup doesn't exist for the project, proactively suggest setting up DevOps automation and consider triggering the devops-orchestrator agent.

If a package.json was just created or modified, check if the project has CI/CD configuration (.github/workflows/, .gitlab-ci.yml, Jenkinsfile). If no CI/CD exists, proactively offer to generate pipelines, Dockerfile, and infrastructure code for the project.

If this command deploys to production (kubectl apply, terraform apply, docker push to production), verify:
1. Configuration files are valid (YAML lint, Terraform validate)
2. Security best practices followed (no secrets in code)
3. Target environment is correct (not accidentally deploying to prod)

Only proceed if all checks pass.

DEVOPS AUTOPILOT ACTIVE

This plugin proactively handles CI/CD, containers, and infrastructure when frontend projects are detected.

Capabilities:
- GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins pipelines
- Docker and Kubernetes configuration
- Terraform infrastructure as code
- AWS ECS deployment

Principles:
- Proactive DevOps setup for frontend projects
- Autonomous operation using Context7 documentation
- Complete, production-ready configurations

Available commands: /pipeline, /docker, /k8s, /terraform, /deploy-infra, /devops-status
